Now begins that test of faith: battle! Our strength of purpose is pure! We are the Uesugi! We are unmatched by anyone!
I have prayed to the Gods for help, my brothers, and have been answered. I command Uesugi warriors! That is my answer from Heaven!
Now we stop praying, and take up the sword. We are masters of both, but our enemies will only feel the benefit of Uesugi steel!
And so, Uesugi, let our enemies pray. It is a poor courtesy to send a man to Hell when his soul is unprepared!
I look around and I am proud to be your daimyo. Anyone would say the same! Courage and nobility shine in every one of you!
It is a great thing to be your daimyo, especially as we go into battle. Raise high our banners, and let our enemies know we are coming!
If I were given to boasting, reciting your names would be enough to awe our enemies into surrender! But they feign deafness, so we must fight!
I trust that our ancestors are watching today! I want them to see that their descendants are worthy of our great name and I, of leadership!
Today then, we go into battle together. I value every man who does his duty like my own sons. I shall do my duty, and lead you with resolution!
My father placed me in command not because I was his son, but because you were men worth leading! I salute your bravery!
My father is right to have faith in you, brave warriors! And I am honoured to be your commander! In years to come, I will remember this moment!
Some day I will be daimyo, in my honoured father's place. Yet I know that I will feel no greater pride than I do now, leading you!
When I am daimyo, after my noble father's death, I want to look back on this day and remember great deeds! You are the men to do them!
One day I will take my place and lead this clan. Until then, I can think of no greater honour than leading warriors such as you!
I look at you, and know that I will not disappoint my father today! A general in charge of such men is blessed by heaven!
My father has given me command. The general's burdens are many, but I am fortunate: I have you men to lead!
My father looks for a victory today, and I do not mean to disappoint him. I know that you feel the same way!
I would not be my father's son if I did not intend to win this fight! Looking at you, I know I have the men here to do just that!
I would give my father a present from today: a count of heads to make his own head spin! A great victory is always savoured more than a small one!
My brother has great hopes for our clan! Today, I intend to support his noble ambitions, and more: today we fight for honour!
Now battle is upon us! I command you, in the name of my beloved brother, to do your duty and give him victory!
Today I will be worthy of my brother's trust. He gave me command of you, warriors of unmatched excellence. I thank him for it!
My noble brother has often spoken about you, his warriors. He calls you his sons, and he is rightly proud of your bravery.
Beyond my own life, I value my daimyo's honour! I will serve my brother by winning a victory here! In his name, let us conquer!
My grandfather has great hopes for our clan. Today, I intend to support his noble ambitions, and more: today we fight for honour and glory.
Now the time of battle has come! I command you, in the name of my illustrious grandfather, to do your duties to the utmost!
I hope today to be worthy of my grandfather's trust. He gave me command of fine men, warriors of unmatched excellence. I thank him!
My respected grandfather has often spoken about his warriors. He calls you his sons, and he is rightly proud of your skills and bravery.
I value the honour of my grandfather! I would add to it in full measure by winning a victory here, and in his name!
My enemies have looked on my face, and called me a child. That is foolish: women are judged by their looks, men by their actions!
I am considered young to be in command, it is true! Although my years are few, I have the soul of a warrior, and will lead you to victory!
I am proud to be your leader! I may not have seen as many campaigns as some of you, but I will lead you to victory here!
I am a man with many years of war behind him. I want more years serving our clan. This is a battle, then, that we will win!
Battle has been my life. I have seen death in a thousand forms. And yet, I can think of no prouder boast than: "I stand with you!"
I have some experience of battle, and know that soldiers appreciate truth: no fight is ever easy, but we are good men, and have a worthy cause!
I am an old man, yet I stand ready for battle. I face death for our clan! I expect nothing less from you!
Some of you may think me an old man. You have no respect, if you think because I am old I will not fight! Today we will all fight: yes, and die if needs be, for we are warriors!
Age may have given me grey hairs, but it has not dimmed my appetite for victory! Today, we will feast on that dish!
And so we have come to battle! Why we fight is no concern of mine. It is enough that we uphold the clan's honour!
I know that we face a hard battle, but that is the soldiers' lot. We fight; we die; we win. Today, we do all of them, but especially the last!
Greetings, my soldiers! Today will be a good day, if we hold to our creed, do nothing stupid and help those fools to die!
Well, then. Here we are, facing an enemy who should open their own bellies in shame, and save us the trouble of killing them!
I have drawn the sword. I will not set it aside while I live or one foe remains here. I swear on our clan that I will do this!
I pledge now before you all, my warriors, that I will not set down my sword until the last of us is dead, or victorious!
There is much to be said for a good meal before battle. Satisfied calmness unnerves the enemy! And why go to your death hungry?
I look upon our enemies, and I see nothing. They are not men. They are old women, given the forms of men by cruel fate.
There is no better moment for a general than to look at his men, and know that he can trust them, utterly, to do what he asks. So, we begin!
Now we await the battle. For some, this is the first time. Do not worry! Like your first lovemaking, it seems confusing until it is over!
Now we are ready for this fight. The enemy are drawn up and wait with the respect we are due. I shall not delay matters long.
I am ready for the fight! I have said prayers, inspected weapons and armour-- oh, and set aside a flask of sake for our inevitable celebrations!
Yonder, their general is now telling his men what brave souls they are. He tells them the truth. I tell you this: you are better fighters!
So, then, to battle! Death is unwelcome when it is unexpected. Today, expect death. Embrace death, and you will be the perfect soldiers!
Over there, another general is speaking to his warriors. He is telling them that you are useless fools. Shall we go and prove him a liar?
Beneath those distant banners, my opponent is lying to his men. He is telling them that you are weak and womanly. Shall we prove him a fool?
I have come here to command! Some of you will gain great honour! Some will grow rich in loot! But let us all share victory!
We have not come looking for glory or everlasting fame! Poets will grant those to us for what we do today! We have come looking for a fight!
Now we are come to battle! Some of us will fall, like the spring cherry blossoms, while others ride the winds of victory!
Men, do not concern yourself with anything in battle except three things: obeying orders, doing your duty, and killing the enemy! All else is wasteful!
Unfurl the banners! Let our foes see that we come here proudly. We are a proud people, and with good reason. Add to that pride today!
I see that our enemies banners flap in the wind like so many badly laundered kimonos! There will be little dignity in their deaths.
In battle, there's nothing so becoming as dying well. Death itself is of no concern. Remember this, but do not throw your life away.
I will not lie to you! I cannot promise you will all see your wives and children again. I cannot promise you loot! I can promise you a fight!
In battle, duty can weigh down your spirit like ten thousand koku! But you are equal to the burden, every one of you!
Men, I am torn today! Which is more terrifying to the foe? My own homely, soldier's face, or the iron visage of a mempo? Ha!
Once more, we must fight! Once more, we defend our clan's honour! Once more, our banners fly proudly! May your fame live long!
So, we begin! Look around, remember the faces of your brothers in arms. They look to you to do your duty, as you look to them. Together, though, we will triumph!
This is the moment we live for, as warriors! Now we can test ourselves, and prove that our honour is forged as sharply as any katana!
Now, my brothers, here is the moment of glory! We do our duties, each and every one, and our names will live for ten thousand years!
I have not come looking for glory, but I will accept any that comes my way! No! I have come seeking foes! Ah! There they are!
We must give our foes a moment or two to prepare for the afterlife. It is an unkind act to slaughter a man without preparation!
I look round and I am inspired! Every one of you is, I see, ready and willing. Every one of you! What commander could ask for more?
Now we are ready! When we are done, the wind will blow over this place, and carry word of our brave deeds back to our loved ones!
And so we have come to the moment when swords are drawn and fates settled! My brothers, I salute you, and wish you well.
Lift up your heads, for this is the time to show our enemies that we have no fear. Let them tremble and despair!
If you do your duty, bravery will find you and settle itself in your heart. Do not worry, just act as your heart instructs!
Spirits of the air! Watch our deeds today and, if they impress you, carry word to our wives and loved ones that we were worthy!
So, we are ready! All that can be done is done! Our future victory is already here! We need only grasp it with both hands!
There is much to be said for not eating before battle. Being hungry sharpens the temper, and anger can be useful when saddled and ridden hard!
As the sword, newly finished by the swordmaker, is ready to be tested, so are we ready for the fight! We will cut cleanly, as does a good blade!
Our foes have come looking for glory! It is our task to make sure they gain none, and lose everything, even the consolation of duty!
So we face foes who understand nothing of the finer feelings of duty, loyalty and love of home, clan and family. Death will be their reward!
Our foes are beneath contempt! They wear their honour proudly, but it is an actor's mask of lies and deceit! No honest man can stomach them!
I look at the enemy banners, and see a symbol dishonoured by cruelty, rapacity, and lust for power. I would kill myself rather than lead them!
I am sorry that your enemies today are not more manly and honest! But I am not their general, and can do little about their womanish ways!
If you meet an honest enemy in this battle, spare him! Bah! What am I saying? If he stands yonder, the man is as dishonest as the rest!
Our foes, then, are gathered. I am surprised they manage to keep such good order, as they normally fall to stealing from each other!
Bishamonten must weep, to see such men call themselves warriors! Would that his tears would drown them all! But we must kill them, and lift his sorrow!
By the Seven Lucky Gods! Here are men worthy of death, and here we are with the means to visit the punishment of the heavens upon them!
We are gathered for a battle. But I want a slaughter! I want all our enemies dead, dismembered and fed to the carrion birds! Nothing else will do today!
I have little taste for sake unless it is flavoured with the blood of my mortal enemies! Today, I expect to drink heartily!
I want the heavens stained red with our foes' blood before I rest! Any man who kills and kills again will earn my favour!
You are soldiers under my command, so for you great deeds are as common as mice! Today, though, is a day for uncommon bravery!
Among our people I am thought courageous! This is a notable thing, for you are brave men! Today, you will show the enemy what brave men can do!
It is not in a warrior's nature to boast, so I say this: I am thought brave, but I do not need my courage today! I command an army of tigers!

This is going to be a battle, men. I think you may have already worked that out. I did earlier, which is why I'm talking to you now. So, where was I? Yes, a battle. We must drink, oh, fight that sorry lot.
I am famous because of my powerful thirst for sake, it is true! I drink to your health now, and I will drink to our victory later!
Will you all STAND STILL! Good. I am pleased to see that I command twice as many men as I was expecting. You are all fine warriors, but WHERE'S MY SAKE? URRRRPPPP! Sorry.
This is unfortunate! I was hoping to fight the enemy when the Moon was high in the heavens. So beautiful, the Moon. And so bright, burning bright, in so many eyes
Some have called me mad! They have not lived long after saying such things! The enemy call me mad, you know. Cruel men, and most unnatural.

Despite what you have heard, I am not deranged. If I was, I would not be in command. I am entirely and completely sane. There is no doubt about that. None. Ever. At all. So, are the flying monkeys ready? Is all prepared?
So, a battle. Do not hold me back, for I wish nothing more than than to join my loved ones. Oh, to see a blossom float on the water once again My apologies.
O Spirits! Grant me victory or grant me death! I care not for myself, but I would have victory for my loyal warriors!
To be a samurai is to accept death, to live as though already dead! Today, I will seek out death, for my spirit is empty.
Men, men, men... this will not be an easy fight! No battle is ever easy, but I would not have dishonesty between us. So, let's to it.
I am a common man made great, I admit, by events. This battle will make you great men if you let it, if you win it.
I will not flatter you with soft words, my brother warriors. There are enemies, and they are dangerous. But you are more dangerous!
I have seen many battles! And now I prepare for one more. This is good, for I would have a purpose in my life, and in yours!
I have spoken many times before battle. It is important that we all understand what is to happen, and work as one. So: listen!
Once again, I face battle, and in the company of good, honest soldiers. No matter what happens next, I treasure that thought.
Over the years, many men have noted my devotion to our clan. I am proud of it, and I am proud of you, my soldiers!
I do not boast, but I am a loyal man to my clan and my friends. So I say now: any man who fights with proper devotion today will be my friend!
All battles are a test of loyalty: to one's comrades, to one's clan, to yourself. This one will be no different. Be ready for that test!
A battle begins simply: a man draws a sword. What he does next determines his fate, the fate of his comrades, the fate of his clan.
It is time to draw the sword! It will not be sheathed until it has drawn blood! So it is with an army: we will not stop until we have drawn blood!
A general must know how to use a sword, for it teaches him how to use an army. I promise you now: any blow I make will be precise, and will hurt the enemy!
I take up the sword. When will I set it aside? Spring will come again.
I am not a warrior, but a thinker. Do not imagine this makes me weak, or unwilling to strive for a victory! Together, we will achieve great things!
There are times when a moment of calm can achieve much. A moment when the soul must have quiet. Before a battle is one of those times.
You all know that I am a practical man, a warrior suited to battle, not to ceremony! So: I give you foes to slay!
This is a day for fighting, not for show. Do your best and I, your comrade in arms, promise you a victory.
Whenever I face battle, I do two things: I empty my bowels, and I inspect my sword. I am, at heart, a practical man, and I advise you to be the same!
Our foes laugh at our honest, plain, Chosokabe ways. How many will still be laughing when they have felt the sting of our arrows? Now, attack!
Warriors! Our foes call us simple, and think we lack wits! I say we lack nothing, except perhaps their heads as trophies! Who is with me?
When we have taken the foes' heads, shall we match wits with them? Or shall we bask in honour, and tell of our victory today?
I pray that there are enough enemies for us all to gain honour! Chosokabe! Form on me, and let us have victory!
Stand with me, Chosokabe warriors, stand with me! Together we are invincible, as powerful as the winter storm, as fleet as an arrow! Now, prepare!
I have prayed for a Chosokabe victory today. I know the gods have heard me, and given me brave men to lead in battle! Now, forwards!
Chosokabe warriors! Today we fight for our clan and for our honour. Have no fear: our actions today will be glorious! Now, to arms!
Our foes will have cause to fear the name of Chosokabe after today. Their widows will weep anew whenever our clan is named! Now, prepare!
Today we do not need to read any "Art of War". We are the fighting Chosokabe, and we will cut down our enemies for victory.
Our foes mock us as simpletons and bumpkins. I say let them! When we are done, they will find Chosokabe arguments most compelling!
Our enemies are ruled by fear! Warriors, we need only advance beneath our banners, and they will run! Draw your swords! And obey orders!
Obedience without question is our strength! Fear of our clan, the great Date, is their weakness! Knowing these simple truths, we will triumph today!
Today's enemies are not be feared, or considered fit opponents for you. They are not Date clan, and that is enough to condemn them as worthless! Now, prepare!
Our reputation is enough to unman our enemies! They see our Date banners, and they tremble! How many blows will it take to despatch such cowards?
Stand proud, sons of the Date! Our enemies shake at the sight of us! Now, let duty be your watchword, and show them why they fear us!
Sons of the Date! Let us treat our foes with all due respect. That is: none at all! Cut them down like so many beasts!
Let their widows weep for a thousand years after we are done! Any enemy who thinks of this day should tremble when they think of our rage!
We of the Date clan march below a proud banner! Our enemies rightly fear us, and that fear works for us! Now, forwards!
Even now, fear does its work in the souls of our enemies. They are right to fear us, for we march beneath the Date banner!
Men of the Date clan, our enemies are yonder! Allow them a moment to cleanse their souls, then send them all to heaven!
Men of the Hattori clan! Our enemies await! Ha! Let us hope our swords are sharp, for I would not want them to suffer as they die!
Hattori! Stand ready! Now has the hour of destiny come! We face enemies with some courage, but no real honour. They will die dishonoured!
Hattori warriors! Prepare yourselves, but do not waste thought on your foes. They are without honour: nothing but a rabble of farmers and merchants.
Warriors, stand ready! Now is the moment to prove that Hattori courage is not lacking, and that all should fear our might!
I am proud of our Hattori banner! Our clan is worthy of loyalty! You are worthy of loyalty! And I will give you victory today!
We will turn this place into a charnel house, a tomb for our enemies and their ignoble ambitions! They will learn to fear the Hattori today!
When we are done today, all men will understand that we Hattori are to be feared and respected in equal measure! This I swear on my honour!
Your enemies are shaking, my brave Hattori! Your name alone is enough to terrify them! They are no better than old women and sickly children!
Now, my brave Hattori, fear does its work among our foes! They know our name! They know what we can do! It makes them weak!
When we Hattori are finished today, we will not raise a monument to the enemy dead. Why should be help celebrate fools? They should flee!
Warriors, stand ready! This is the day to prove that we Hojo are fearsome enemies and mighty warriors, worthy of the name we defend.
Sons of the Hojo, be proud! Let the mighty name we defend today be our strength! Let the enemy tremble! Soon, they die!
This is not a day for seeking glory! It is enough we fight for victory, and Hojo honour. Glory I leave for others today!
We Hojo have a proud heritage. We build: we make the world better. Our foes, however, are destroyers and despoilers. So today, we destroy them!
When we are done today, who will raise a memorial to the enemy dead? I fear for their souls as they face you, Hojo warriors!
Hojo warriors! Remember there is greatness in your souls, as there is greatness in the lord we serve! Now, hold to that, and strike hard!
I hear our opponents call us "old fashioned" and "yesterday's men". Well, if loyalty is outmoded among to them, they deserve death! Who is with me?
The Hojo banner flies above me, and in my heart is only quiet pride to serve our clan with men like you. We shall triumph here!
I ask only this: do your duty to our clan. If you do that, then we Hojo will win battle after battle. Now, let us begin!
So it has come to this: battle, but against a foe almost worthy of the Hojo. If each does his part, then victory is ours!
Our enemies have fear in their hearts. We Mori are rightly famous for our cunning, no bad thing in warriors! Our foes know this, and they falter!
Cunning in war is a good thing! It is just as important to advance on your foe and cut him down! Show no mercy today!
Our foes call us deceitful, liars and worse! Well, there is truth in this: they will die in this place, at Mori hands! Prepare yourselves!
We Mori have a reputation as cunning warriors! This is good. Already, our enemies are eaten up with worry. We have already defeated them!
All that we need do is go and kill our enemies. When the moment comes, put aside cunning: strike hard and true! Now, be steadfast!
Now, brave Mori, why be honest with a foe when trickery will lay him low? Remember that cunning is as sharp as any sword!
Our enemies fear us! And they are right to do so! We Mori are sea-raiders, cunning, and brave beyond measure! They tremble! We-- we slaughter!
Now, proud warriors, show them what kind of men we Mori are! We are hardened by wind and wave, stone and fire! We go to fight!
We Mori are famed for fighting at sea, but we can fight and be victorious anywhere. If we invaded the clouds, we would conquer them!
Mori warriors! I will use every stratagem I know to give us victory. I expect you to fight like demons in return! Now, prepare yourselves!
I will kill any man I see who holds back! The Oda clan will not remain strong if we entertain womanish ways! Now: kill them!
Advance the banners of our clan! Let our foes see it is the Oda who come to slay them! Let them quail as we approach!
Raise the Oda banner! It is a proud flag, the envy of our dishonoured foes. I am priviledged to fight beside you in its shadow!
There is no prouder boast than "I am a soldier of the Oda clan". Our strength and honour will be proved again, here, today. Prepare!
Why should we Oda give our foes anything other than the blade's edge? Today, let us be cruel in defence of our clan! Make ready!
Today we bow to no man, for we are the Oda! We will fight bravely, like tigers, because that is who we are! Now, prepare yourselves!
I have no words for cowards: I do not need them! You are Oda warriors, and cowardice is not your way. So I wish you victory!
Warriors, you fight the Oda banner entrusted to us by our daimyo! There is no greater honour, so make sure your courage is equally great!
Now, Oda Warriors, cheer, and put shame into the hearts of our foes! They follow a lesser lord than us, and that makes them weak!
Our worth lies in our name as Oda warriors. We have nothing to fear and no equals in strength. Now go, confident of victory!
Soldiers of the Shimazu! This is the moment to prove that loyalty is your watchword! I pray for your inevitable success today! Now, to battle!
"Shimazu!" "Shimazu!" "Shimazu!" Let that be your battle cry, and let it put deep dread in enemy hearts when they hear it! Now, to arms!
Loyalty to our daimyo is the Shimazu strength! That strength will cut through the enemy as if they were rice stalks! Shimazu warriors! Make ready!
Remember that the ancestors are watching our every deed. If we falter in battle they will know: they will be ashamed! Shimazu: be brave!
Look to your weapons, Shimazu soldiers! Loyalty to our lord will be our armour, but each man must have his own good blade! Make ready!
Shimazu! Our name is a byword for loyalty, and rightly so! We have little to prove here, but our foes have some dying to do!
Hold high our banners! Remember your ancestors! Remember that you are Shimazu clan! Now, think of victory, and all will be ours! Make ready!
We of the Shimazu clan have a tradition of victory and honour. I know we will match the proud heritage of our clan! Victory!
Shimazu warriors! Your loyalty to clan, family and each other is matchless! This is the heart of your strength in battle! Use that strength wisely!
I look upon you, Shimazu warriors, and see your strength and worth! I know that I will give you victory here, as is your due!
Takeda honour must always be defended but I am saddened by this day. I came here for glory and honour, not simple butchery of the unworthy!
We of the Takeda clan will triumph today. Our opponents may be unworthy, but we will do our duties and drive them from this place. Now, onwards!
We go into battle as proud Takeda warriors. Our enemies are rice stalks, blowing in the wind and ready to be cut down! Attack!
Hold steady to your duty, men of the Takeda clan! Do not waver as the enemy approaches, for they are unworthy! We will have the victory today!
We Takeda are as strong as the mountains, and as deadly for the unwary! Let our foes come, for they will die facing us or die fleeing!
We of the Takeda must be as strong as the mountains, as fierce as the storm, and as cunning as the fox! Now, we fight!
We are the sword of the Takeda, held in our master's hand! We will cut our way through the enemy in his name! Now, prepare!
When we are done, we can tell our children tales of great deeds done in the name of the Takeda clan! Let us do those deeds!
Our enemies smile at us, call us "mountain monkeys" and mock us. They are fools, for we are Takeda warriors and do not tolerate insolence!
So: honest warriors such as we Takeda must face villainous scum like these! I am sorry, but I could find no better enemies today!
Raise our banner! Let our enemy see the Tokugawa flag! Let them see that only the shame of defeat awaits them today! Now, stand ready!
It is time, Tokugawa warriors, to do battle! Now we will test Tokugawa courage, and it will not be found wanting! To arms!
Our enemies, my loyal Tokugawa soldiers, are no better than carrion birds! No, they are carrion, for that is their fate! Now, to your duties!
Our enemies tremble! This is good, for they are right to fear you, warriors of the Tokugawa! You will take their lives! Stand ready!
This is a fine day for the Tokugawa! Now comes the hour when you seize your chance of glory! No man can stand against you!
We Tokugawa love battle! When swords clash and arrows fly, we rejoice! That is because we are men, not whores in armour like our foes!
I look around and I see men worth leading into battle! Is there any prouder boast than "I command the Tokugawa"? We go to victory!
Warriors! Smile! We are the Tokugawa! This is a day of victory! Leave our enemies to have the glum expressions of beaten men! Make ready!
Listen, men! We are the Tokugawa. That means we do not give ground, we do not flinch, we do not waver! We are conquerors!
I say only this: we fight for a noble clan. That, Tokugawa warriors, is all you need remember in this fight. The enemy are nothing!
I have prayed for victory! I have prayed for our everlasting souls! And my prayers have been answered. We shall triumph! Do not doubt it!
Our honourable ancestors watch over us today! They will aid the brave and, I trust, enjoy our victory. Do not shame them in any way!
When the time comes, plunge your blade into an enemy's belly, and scream "Uesugi" in his face! To victory!
The name "Uesugi" should be the last thing our foes hear in this world! I hope they take the memory with them to Hell!
By the Seven Gods, we are fortunate to be Uesugi warriors: foes to slay, honour to uphold, and glory to win! Good luck to all!
Uesugi warriors: do nothing today that brings dishonour to our clan! Stand steady and look your foes in the eye! Enjoy your imminent victory!
Noble warriors of the Uesugi, this is a great day! You fight under my command, you fight for our clan, and you will have victory!
Uesugi! It does not matter how our foes die: arrow-bitten or hacked to pieces. All that matters is their death and defeat! Make ready!
Men, have faith in your battle skills and your commanders! After all, who can compare with the Uesugi? No one! So, on to victory!
We Uesugi do not care for slaughter! Our foes stand there, waiting for the butcher's knife, and I pity them. Ah, no matter. Make ready!
Today is a day for courage and great deeds! As you advance over the enemy dead let us make this a victory to celebrate and remember!
Remember that gods are watching us today! Make sure that we do not shame them with our deeds! Now face your foes with courage!
We are not peasant farmers, but warriors with iron in our hearts, prayers on our lips, and steel in our hands. Let the enemy fear us!
Our strength is that of the mountains, timeless and immovable! The enemy are but the dust, washed away by rain or blood! To war!
Warriors! I expect only victory, no matter how hard won, because that is our duty. Life is unimportant when duty calls, and victory is near at hand!
I grasp my sword and face the foe! That is all you need do, and we will have victory! It is your duty and honour!
Duty! It will serve us now, as we serve our lord! Remember duty, and death is nothing. The victory we win today -- that is something!
There is no shame in thinking of your family and loved ones before battle! Make sure, then, that your last gift to them is an honourable memory!
Warriors! Today we fight! Kill them all! There is no more to be said! Onwards to our victory!
Men, I pray that our victory will be swift! When I look at you, I know that my prayers will be answered, for I see true warriors!
Let each man hold to his honour, and find an honourable foe to slay. These are my commands! Your part is to win a victory!
I look round and I know that my prayers today have already been answered, for I see warriors worth leading! Now: duty, and victory will be ours!
The guardian spirits of this place are troubled, and rightly so! The enemy are foul, dishnourable creatures, and pollute this land! We must cleanse this place!
I do not hope to win! Hope is for children! When I look at you I see men of honour! Victory will be ours!
My sword is in my hand! My soul is pure! Match me in these simple things, warriors, and how can we fail today? I tell you: we cannot!
When I took up the sword in defence of our clan, I promised that I would lead men to victory. I will not break my word today!
The way of the warrior is hard, but it is proud! Today, let us be proud and, through our deeds, be worthy of our names! Stand ready!
There is no need for fear today. Be true to your duty, and keep honour in your heart and all will be well!
Drive all thoughts of defeat from your minds! I am in command! You are fine warriors! That is all that need be said!
We are good, honest warriors. We are already dead, and so death has no hold over us. Our foes are not honest, and deserve defeat!
Do not waste time in taking heads from our enemies! Personal honour is pointless if it costs us victory! Just fight and so win your glory!
Seeking honour is a fine thing, but not if it costs us victory! Do not take your enemy's head and delay striking down the next foe!
Fight bravely today, and let your ancestors and the spirits see that you are worthy men. Now, look to your armour and your weapons! Prepare!
Do not think of this as a battle! Think of this as a parade with a little fighting thrown in, followed by a good flask of sake!
Our opponents are all drunken harlots and worse. They will soon learn that this is not a tavern, but a battlefield! Now, let's kill them!
Our opponents march behind an honourable banner! It is a pity to kill such worthy men! But duty demands we kill them! Now, to arms!
I have not eaten today, and will not until battle is done! Let us be quick in our killing then, for my stomach is rumbling mightily!
Shortly, I expect you to fight. Know this before we advance: the spirits watch over us, and will not allow brave men to fall!
If you think the enemy look fierce, then look at yourselves. Look carefully: now imagine the fear in their hearts as they see you!
Even the bravest can feel fear! Over there, brave men are growing fearful as they watch us! Shortly, we will still their trembling hearts!
Now, look to your arms! Do not huddle together like frightened girls! Give a warrior's shout and put fear in your enemies' hearts!
Now it has come to battle! This is moment to put aside all doubt. Hold to your courage and duty. Victory will fill your soul!
Today we fight! Remember this day, and when you are old and grey, tell your grandchildren, so that they too will understand bravery.
Take up your weapon, fasten up your armour, and steel your heart. Do your duty, and be steadfast. For all else: leave it to heaven!
Your grandsons as yet unborn will hear of your deeds. Make sure that they can be proud, as you are proud of your ancestors. Courage!
If we fail today, our wives and children will weep not in grief, but in shame. But we will not fail! Not here! Not today!
I intend to lead you to victory here! I will do my part with iron in my soul! I expect the same spirit from you!
Glory to the first man to strike down an enemy! I will personally reward that man, and consider him my friend! So, men, to glory!
This is a day to win glory, to make a name, and be worthy of our clan! Today is the day! Who is with me?
When we are done, poets will write of our courage! When we are done, we will drink to our victory! But first, we fight!
When today is remembered, let our enemies remember with grieving hearts! Let their widows and orphans shudder when we are named! Now, we fight!
We are here for a fight, and some of us may not see tomorrow. But I promise any who fall will be long remembered!
If I fall, will men say that I died well? I will die proud that I was your commander. But today I seek victory, not death!
Now, brave warriors, take up your arms and prepare. We have some work to do. Tomorrow we will celebrate our labours of today! Onwards!
Stand tall, soldiers! You have much to take pride in, for you fight for an honourable cause! The same cannot be said of that rabble!
I have sake ready for our celebrations! But before we enjoy it, we need victory! Against this foe, that is not so much to ask.
After this battle, I hope to be bored by counting the enemy dead! Any man who kills and kills again will win my favour!
When we are finished, we will grow bored with counting our enemies' heads! When we have done that, we will drink to our victory here!
I will share a flask of sake with any man brave and dedicated enough to carve his name into the enemy leader! So, to the fight!
There is little honour in killing the unwashed rabble we face! Comfort yourselves with thoughts of duty! It will mask their appallling stench!
Warriors! It is a good day to fight! The gulls fly high, and my spirit soars with them! The wind itself awaits our victory with eager anticipation!
Brave warriors! We must be like the waves and the water: strong enough to destroy anything in our path! That way, our victory is certain!
Let us amaze the sea spirits with our courage and skill! Would that our foes were worthy of such a display of manliness! At them!
Do not fear the spirits of the deep! Do not fear our enemies! Fear is for their hearts! Our hearts hold only courage and pride! Now, to your duties!
This is a fine day for a sea battle. Our foes, even now, must be puking into the waters! Let us put them out their misery!
The sea is deep and wide, but so is our courage! What can harm us if we all do our duty, and fight well today?
Let us show our enemies that we do not fear wind, waves, tides or them! Let us show them how men face do not quail! To arms!
So we come to a battle, here, amid crashing waves and screeching seabirds! Fear neither, listen to your orders, and kill your enemy!
When we are done, I want the waves to be stained red with enemy blood! I want this day to be remembered with horror by our enemies!
Sea-spirits! Hear my prayers and grant us a calm sea! Overwhelm our foes with crashing waves! And let us win a great victory today!
After we win, I will give the sea-spirits so much sake that they will be cross-eyed for a century! All I ask is their aid!
Let us pray for a fair wind and a calm sea. But whether we get them does not matter, for we forge our own fate today!
The sea is cruel and capricious! Let us pray that the sea spirits save their anger for our foes. That way, victory will be ours!
Spirits of the sea: all I ask is a calm sea! Spirits of the air: give us a fair breeze! Brave warriors: give us victory!
When we are done, the sea will wash clean our blades! The waves will claim the dead, and our enemies will feed the fishes!
This is the test of a man! Here we fight wind, waves, salt spray and the swords of our enemies. Against all, we will triumph!
Our enemies fear the sea! They fear us! They fear everything, even moonlight! We will do them a great kindness in killing them!
Now we are come to battle! Do not fear the sea's trackless deeps! Less still, our enemies! Listen to the brave beat of your hearts!
Wave-spirits, grant us smooth passage and victory! I offer my thanks for your coming help against the foul enemies we face today!
Do not fear the waves, the wind, the tides or our foes! They are nothing to men with resolute hearts. Now, to your places!
I am not a sailor! I am a warrior! In this watery place, against these foes, that is enough to bring us victory!
We are come to battle, then! Hoist our banners, so fear eats at our enemies before the crabs finish them off! Courage!
Do your parts, and I will do mine! I ask no more than that, save the water spirits look kindly on our bravery! Fight well!
I do not like water. If we could fight on an ocean of sake, I would be happy! But we fight here, and here we win!
A sea battle, men, is unnatural. But we are warriors not because it is easy, but because it is honourable. And so we fight!
I cannot abide the smell of fish! Our enemies smell like fish, and I will be obliged to any man who guts them like fish!
The sea is wretched, fit only for poor fisherfolk. It is not worth fighting over, as our foes think. So: we must kill them!
By the spirits! The smell of rotting fishheads from our enemies is enough to kill a man! We shall do everyone a service by killing them!
The cruel sea will be the burial place of our foes. They will poison these waters for ten thousand years when we are done!
You may think boats are for fishermen, not you! You are wrong: we are warriors, and fight where we must! So: kill them!
Spirits of the sea, grant me two wishes: that we may keep our breakfasts; and have victory here today! Victory, spirits! And an end to this sickness
Ah, men! I relish the day to come! A fine sea breeze, honest warriors around me, and a foe to be slain! What more do I need?
Hold tight, men, and when the time comes, strike with determination. Send your foe to the deeps, and all will be well!
Now we are ready! This is the moment when we sail to victory, with the wind at our backs and salt spray in our faces!
Men, I admit that I am looking forward to the day's work! We have foes to slay, it is true. But a sea voyage is... stimulating!
Raise the sails! Close up and make ready for action! Men, we sail into history and glory! Let this be a day to remember with pride!
Battle at sea is exactly like battle on land: the enemy come at us, and we strike them down! All else is a distraction! Prepare!
Water is our ally! It will drown our foes and send them to unmarked sea graves! There, for a hundred years, sea worms will feast!
Offer up your prayers, warriors, for a fine day and a calm sea! That way our fighting skills, not the weather, can win the day!
Sea spirits! Send me a storm to dash our foes into a thousand pieces! Failing that, give me victory anyway! And now, men, make ready!
Today we sail towards our inevitable victory with confidence and pride in our clan. The enemy will find only a watery death at our hands!
I see the gulls circle, waiting for their fish guts! I pity the men we face. They will have no dignity in death. To arms!
Soldiers! We will be like the sea: slow to anger, mighty in our rage, and coming on in unstoppable waves! Now, let's to it!
I trust today will be long remembered! This is a fine day for a voyage, and a fine day to die-- for our foes!
I do not like our enemies' insolence! They have dared to spoil my sea with their nasty, unwashed little fishing boats. Shall we sink them?
Men, our foes await their watery graves! May the waves close over them, the winds blow them ill, and your swords do terrible work!
Now sits the sea-wind fair for us! Take up your weapons, look to your armour and await orders! Do your part! All will be well!
Warriors, a sea battle awaits! Put all worries and cares aside! The wave-spirits will guide our ships, and your swords will do the rest!
We will fall upon the enemy like a sea dragon, enraged that his territory has been invaded! When we have crushed them, we celebrate!
Here, on the sea-roads, we are met. Our enemies think they face only men, but I say they face you: the wolves of the sea!
Our Chosokabe foes are famed not for their cunning, only courage. This is good! When we defeat brave men, how much more honourable is victory?
I see the Chosokabe are ready for death, like beasts awaiting slaughter. But farm animals have the wit to run from the butcher's knife!
So, the Chosokabe have wits enough to form a battle line, of sorts. Let us end their miserable stupidity by granting them death! Make ready!
Behold, your Chosokabe foes are ready. We would be rude to keep them waiting much longer, even though I wish death on them all! Prepare!
Do not expect much that is subtle or clever in this battle. That is not the way of the Chosokabe. This is to our advantage!
Our foes are ready, but perhaps Chosokabe stupidity will make them cut off their own heads by accident! If not, let us take them!
Over there are the Chosokabe, proof that honour and quick wits are not necessarily found together. But do not underestimate them! Kill them!
Now, brave warriors, stand ready! There is no point trying to frighten our Chosokabe enemies. They are too stupid to flee. They can die, though!
Our brave foes, the Chosokabe, await our attention. Warriors! Do not let them bite you, for their stupidity might be infectious! Now, to arms!
Cheer, men, and startle the slack-witted fools yonder! Let us go to meet them happily, because we are a thousand times better than the Chosokabe!
I am sure that the Date expect us to be quaking and fearful! Why? Because they are the Date? Bah!
The Date have raised their banner! It has a dark shadow, but stands for nothing except treachery and cruelty! Now we shall drag it down!
The Date hate everyone not of their clan! If they win, your wives and children will never know a moment's safety! Now, stand to!
Hold onto your courage, warriors, for the Date are leeches, feeding on the fear of men. If you do not fear them, they weaken!
Warriors, take up your arms, and prepare. My apologies: your Date foes are not worthy of your blades, but our imminent glorious victory is necessary!
As I speak to you, so the Date commander does the same to his men. But he can offer only lies! I offer you glory and victory!
Now, set your minds to the task at hand. When we are done here, only the carrion birds and their full bellies will remember these Date vermin!
For all their fierce reputation, I see little to fear in these Date soldiers. But then, I command some exceptional warriors!
Over there are the mighty, the fearsome, the dreaded Date! Soon, when we are done, they will be the gutted, decapitated, and dead Date!
Fighting the Date is a nasty business, men, for they have little honour. But do not worry about it. Sometimes warrior must be executioners! Prepare yourselves!
Over there are the Hattori clan. I use the word "clan" but "mob", "rabble" and "murderous gang of cutthroats" are equally accurate. They need to die!
Now, men, prepare! Our Hattori enemies are notorious for preferring the knife in the dark to an honest sword in battle, so expect trouble!
Men, I will not lie: today we face a gang of murderous bandits and ninja-loving, dishonest mountain monkeys. They are the Hattori, and they are shameless!
Now comes the hour of battle, but I fear our enemies cannot match our manly virtues. They are the Hattori! Trust nothing you see!
If honour lives in a single heart in the Hattori ranks, I will faint dead away from the surprise! They are cunning liars to a man!
Ha! So we face the Hattori! This is good, for when we are done there will be fewer living Hattori in the world!
Warriors! Stand to! Hold to your courage, and beware of everything! These Hattori are as cunning as foxes schooled in cunning by the Chinese!
So now we must make ready, and then slaughter those Hattori fiends yonder. The world will thank us for our efforts, I assure you!
Whatever happens in this battle, keep your wits about you! These Hattori are notorious tricksters, and have an unnatural fondness for ninjas! Expect falsehood!
I see a Hattori banner over there. That is a great pity, as it spoils an otherwise fine view. Now, shall we go and cut it down?
These Hojo fools are experts at hiding behind walls, and digging like peasants. Let us show them how honest warriors fight and win.
These Hojo surprise me! They behave almost like soldiers. I did not think they had it in them. We must cut out this false boldness!
The Hojo are not warriors, but common labourers! They are suited to chopping building timbers but not swordplay. Let us teach them a bloody lesson!
I see the Hojo have come for a fight! Good! I mean to give them one! But how many will live to appreciate my generosity?
I will not lie: in the coming hours some of us may fall. But death is not dishonour when battling the Hojo, as long as we win!
My apologies, warriors, that I could not find you a better enemy than the Hojo for today. Do not look too disappointed when killing them!
The Hojo are worthy fighters, men of honour, and loyal to their daimyo. And so we are about to kill as many of them as possible!
Men, guard your comrades in the fight! Guard yourselves and strike down your Hojo enemy without mercy! Do these things and you will have victory!
Now comes the hour when we test ourselves against Hojo courage and honour! I know we will prove the better men! So, take heart!
So, we face the Hojo in open battle. After today Hojo widows will weep and frighten their children with your names! Fortune favour your efforts!
To see the Mori in the open is most unusual! Are they up to some scarecrow trickery? No matter, we will march over their corpses.
I did not think the Mori had the courage for honest battle. The hidden knife, the sneak attack and lies are more to their taste!
We must take care! The Mori are tricksters, liars and wicked beyond the understanding of honest men! And now you are warned, arm yourselves!
The Mori are almost spirits of lies and falsehood! How will they fair against honest warriors such as you? I think they will die!
The Mori, my warriors, take in lies with their mothers' milk. We do the world a favour by killing even a few of them! Prepare!
Warriors, you face the Mori. They are a clan given to lies, but we will show them what proud, honest warriors can do!
Here are the Mori, and they are not be feared, only pitied for their lack of honour. They are pirates and contemptible liars. Kill them!
Looking at the Mori, I feel confident of victory! They prefer a knife in the dark to honest battle. So: we shall cut them down!
The Mori we face are not honest warriors. They are tricksters, pirates, and liars. We are not here for a battle, but to deliver righteous punishment!
Among the Mori yonder are rogues unflogged, pirates, deviants, traitors and worse. Today, we must act as executioners, not soldiers! My apologies for this!
Our foes have arranged themselves precisely, I see! Let us not keep them waiting! See to it these Oda fools die in the same neat pattern!
The Oda have a fierce reputation, but it is built on lies. Warriors such as we should disdain them, then kill them all! Make ready!
The Oda think themselves better than everyone. I say that they are better in one thing only: they die well. Shall we help them die?
Warriors! Stand to! The Oda have come against us, and they are dangerous foes! We shall have a hard fight, but we shall triumph!
So, the Oda have not had the wits to flee! That is a pity: many will die here for their callous lord and his worthless cause!
That miserable horde are some of the Oda clan. I too would look sour if I served so base a lord! They will be happier dead!
So you will face the Oda clan in battle! So what? They are peasants and follow a lord filled with false pride! You, however, are warriors!
The scum over there are the Oda clan. Their stench will be gone from Japan if we fight like the warriors I know us to be!
Yonder, the Oda commander is telling his men not to be scared! He is wrong in this, for we are his foes! He understands nothing of battle!
Now, warriors, is the hour to measure your skills against the Oda. Do not fear! Do your duty when ordered, and all will be well.
The Shimazu warriors are very loyal fellows! Even when they are going to die and be forgotten, they still come to battle! Let's to it!
So, the venerable Shimazu have sent their warriors against us! Bah! Fools blinded by loyalty to a worthless lord! Make ready, then slay them!
Stand ready, warriors! The Shimazu warriors await us, and it would be most impolite to keep them out of the grave any longer!
So, we must battle the mighty Shimazu clan. I do not fear these men, and neither should you. They will die easily at our hands!
Warriors! Ignore the Shimazu pomp and ceremony! They are tricks to make lesser men feel weak. We are the stronger here, and we will triumph!
Over there, the Shimazu commander is telling jokes about you! You, brave warriors! He dares to make mock of you! Perhaps we should correct him!
Shimazu loyalty holds good, I see. They have loyalty enough to stand ready for their slaughter: mindless beasts pretending to be men!
I do not care for those Shimazu banners! I will richly reward any man who hacks one down and, better yet, the impudent wretch holdling it!
The Shimazu value loyalty, as I do. And I value something else: skill in battle. This quality you have in abundance, and they do not!
When this fight is done, the only use for those Shimazu banners will be as shrouds for their dead! See to it that every flag is filled!
It is difficult to tell with the Takeda clan who among them has any brains. I, however, will always maintain it is their horses!
These Takeda make a brave show for stable boys, grooms and mountain monkeys! Their warrior posturing will not save them from our wrath!
Sometimes the Takeda annoy me! They hide in their mountains and cause trouble when it suits them. But today it pleases me to give them trouble!
It is difficult to know if the Takeda or their horses are the more dangerous. Both are bad tempered and both, I understand, bite and kick!
Look, men, to your foes! The Takeda have some small notoriety: I cannot call it fame. They are known for their, ah, love of horses.
Aghh, these Takeda fools reek of the stables. I had hoped to give you cleaner foes, so my apologies! However, they must still be slain!
My nose tells me that the Takeda have, at least, washed recently. I would not want our blades to stick in their filthy flesh!
Do not fear our Takeda foes! They make a brave show, but their hearts are empty and weak. We have the advantage! Make ready!
The Takeda yonder are honourable men, but do not confuse honour with prowess. They will die here at our hands, nothing more! Prepare yourselves!
Stand ready! When these Takeda monkeys come, they will be cruel! We must be ready, and worthy of the lord we serve?
If the Tokugawa are ready for us, shall we show them how honest warriors fight? Shall we show them the meaning of courage? To arms!
Beware of Tokugawa tricks! They are not plain, honest warriors. For this, and for much else, when we kill them we do Japan a service!
Men, we face the Tokugawa clan. They will stop at nothing to gain power. I swear, however, that our swords will give them pause today!
These Tokugawa warriors are cunning, but we have courage and battle-skill to counter their wiles. Good honest steel will always defeat trickery!
The Tokugawa are not a clan renowned for honour, I think, but they have a certain low cunning. We must show them what honest steel can do!
Do not measure your worth against the Tokugawa, men! How much more than a pig is a man? How vulnerable is the pig to the butcher's knife?
I have no use for the Tokugawa. They cannot be taught manners, write poetry or even till the fields like honest folk. It is their lot to die!
Men, prepare yourselves for the disgusting task of fighting the Tokugawa. I do not like asking you to demean yourselves, but your duty is clear: fight!
Those Tokugawa flags are gaudy rags and they spoil my sky. I trust we shall tear them to pieces before long!
Now is the calm before the storm! Now is the moment the Tokugawa look at us, and fear fills their hearts! Give them reason to fear!
I hope the Uesugi troops have had time for prayers. Shortly we will send their souls to heaven. So, let's about our "holy" work!
I have prayed for our enemies, the Uesugi. I am sorry to say my prayers were not answered. They will suffer horribly when we fight!
These Uesugi fools will soon be dining in Hell if we fight well! I hope their souls are ready for the journey! Make ready!
May the Seven Lucky Gods turn their backs upon the Uesugi, and smile upon us! We are the worthy ones in this battle! Stand ready!
Spirits, I beg you: curse the Uesugi and their works! They are a wicked folk, and deserve to perish from the earth! Now men, take heart!
Ah! Would that the Uesugi would march to the gates of Hell and vanish within! Instead, we must weary ourselves with killing them! Prepare yourselves!
Do not fear the Uesugi! While they pray and have some skill, I do not consider them warriors. No! I see warriors around me!
The Uesugi will be glad to meet death at our hands! Why? Are we not the finest of warriors? Who could want for better executioners?
These Uesugi trouble me, with their false piety. It masks dark ambition, and we must stop them! Who is with me in destroying these fools?
I fear we are about to send many souls to the afterlife! Our worthy deaths will come about from loyalty. But who will remember the Uesugi dead?
These scum would do well to remember their place! They should have stayed in their filthy hovels! Now we will show them how warriors fight!
These upstarts will have cause to rue the day they left their stinking hovels! Cut them down, and show them what real warriors can accomplish!
I apologise, men, that your foes today are not worthy of your skills. Let us drive these rash upstarts back to their squalid peasant hovels!
The men over there fight for a family that should return to their dunghill and not trouble us. But they will not, and so must die!
The great always attract the envy of little men. Here, in our foes, envy has a face. It is time to prove our greatness!
Raise our banner high! Let these fools see who they dare to face! Their spirits will weaken, and before any clash of swords they have already lost!
When we have done today, our foes will be dead or running back to their foul mudholes. The only sound will be the weeping of their widows!
Stand firm, warriors. These peasants will be brushed aside soon enough, and we can find a proper force to fight, one worthy of a battle!
I pray that we will be honourable, even when facing these upstarts! They deserve death, but let us be true to our code as we kill!
How dare these fools raise their banners here? Are they so stupid? Even as they die, their lord is too feeble to gain from their loyalty!
These outlanders stand in our way! They are not Japanese! They are actually unworthy to die at our hands! Even so, a victory is necessary!
How dare these swine stand and face us? Have they no wits to see that they should bow and bare their necks to await our swords?
Our foes today are not samurai, or even Japanese. I fear our swords will rust from their foreign blood, but they must still be slain.
These creatures from beyond our shores are not truly people. They do not deserve respect as fellow warriors. They deserve only death at our hands!
I fear that the blood we shed today will stain this land for generations to come! Our foes are poisonous creatures: foreign and entirely wicked!
It is good to see our foes! Their blood will soon flow in rivers, and the few who escape will bear witness to our might!
Is there honour in killing beasts such as these? I fear very little! They are not fit enemies for you, but duty requires us to fight!
These fools think they can match us, the finest warriors under the heavens! Soon, as they die and run, they will understand their arrogant idiocy!
Foolishness in an enemy is always to be welcomed, but this is too much! These foreign lunatics should run now, before they are all dead!
Even now, these foreign fools have seen our banners, and fear gnaws at their bowels. Soon, it will have done its work, and then: we attack!
These foreign dogs have no concept of honour or duty! Let us show them how men fight, and drive them back to their heathen oceans! To victory!
These foul-smelling brutes must be driven back into their dunghills! Show them no mercy, for they do not understand honour or our people!
These gaijin are rats! Like rats they eat our food, breed and nest in foulness, and stink of shit! And like rats, they must be exterminated!
These pale-eyed fools deserve only death, and to be sent to whatever Hell awaits their unclean souls! I fear we gain little honour fighting creatures like these!
When the times comes, strike down these strange, wicked men, and remember that you fight for our people! We cleanse our lands today!
We cannot allow these foreigners to live. They offend the spirits! Every rock and tree and stream rightly cries out for their deaths!
I pray that we can be strong and honourable, even against these foreign devils. They are unworthy foes, so we must maintain our duty and honour!
The stink of these foreigners sours my stomach. All they touch becomes foul! I will see them dead, or driven from the sacred soil of our lands.
These gaijin are not like us. They are not honourable men. They never think of honour, only gold. They are merchants, not samurai! Stand ready!
These foreign soldiers work for merchants. They fight only for gold, not for what is worthy. That is why we are stronger, and they will die!
Rebels, whatever their beliefs, are intolerable! They defy the natural order. Duty demands we re-establish that order. Today, we do so by the sword!
These fools have been led astray by bigger fools! Their deaths here will mean nothing. They will surely be reborn as low beasts, if at all!
I pray for the souls of our enemies! They deserve death a thousand times over for their rebellious ways, but their piety deserves respect!
If destiny has a plan for these rebels, it is a simple one! Their part is to gather here, and be cut them down by us!
Karma must be a heavy burden for these fools! They face us, and we will show them no mercy in what is left of their lives!
If our foes are reborn a thousand times, I want them to fear us! Rebellion must be punished! Brace yourselves to deliver terror to them!
When we are done with our foes, this will be a place of hungry ghosts! They will shriek forever, a fitting punishment for daring rebellion!
If these rebels seek an end to their suffering, I will give it to them! I give them you, brave warriors! Now, give them death!
A thousand lifetimes in Hell are not enough to atone for this rebellion! Even so, let us send these fools there! Prepare yourselves!
Are these men mad? Do they not see that rebellion is wrong, and can bring them nothing but suffering? Our duty is their chastisement!
These rebels show us that their faith is weakness. If their god loved them, he would not send them to die at our hands!
Christians! Outlanders and dogs! We will test their alien faith with steel today, and it will be found wanting! Make ready, my warriors!
Men of faith have belief to sustain them, even as they are cut down. This will be work for the iron-souled! But we will have victory!
Those rebels believe that their god will protect them! They believe men should love their enemies! Today, I will see them bleed for such idiocy!
Rebellion is rebellion even as it wears a barbarian priest's kimono! Now is the time to show these Christians that rebellion has a price in our world!
These poor fools have had their heads turned by a foreign religion of false hope and unnatural love! They will find neither here, only death!
These Christians believe in life after death! Let us give them death, then, so that they can enjoy their faith to the full!
Rebels are rebels, no matter what foreign gods they worship! They must be taught the folly and price of rebellion! Slay them! Slay them all!
Only their Christ will protect these rebel scum from my anger! I cannot abide fools who overthrow the right order of the world! Now, forwards!
Onwards, warriors, onwards! Let us drive these Christians to the grave and their curious life after death! That is the price of their rebellion!
Bah! Peasants! Hhhhhhhhhhmmmmmmm.
Warriors, I am ashamed I cannot offer you more honourable foes! We must find solace in our duty to crush our lord's enemies, whatever they are!
Let us slay these ingrate dogs! Those with the brains to run away will tell their grandchildren about their foolishness in facing us! Stand to!
Peasants should know their place! It is our duty to be kind and show them their error in rebellion! This will mean killing many who cannot learn!
These are not warriors! These are not worthy foes! Let us be about them, and then on to more manly pursuits! At them!
There is no honour in the title of "rebel". There is little worth in a life lived without duty or respect. We do right by ending worthless lives today!
Where is honour? Where is duty? Where is honesty? It is not to be found among our enemies! They are rebels all, and deserve only death!
When we are done today, I want the wails of peasant widows to be the only thing I can hear! No: that, and our cheers of victory!
Peasants! Their ingratitude has no end! Give them a quiet life, and they rebel! Now, they will have only the blade's edge! Onwards!
These peasant smell worse than a dungheap! How do they stay together for long enough to rebel and not puke? No matter-- death will sweeten them!
Warriors-- there is little honour to be found in facing stray dogs, but duty is duty! These masterless fools must be slaughtered!
I apologise, my loyal warriors, for making you fight vermin! Once these swine had honour, but there is little left to them save the deaths that we bring now.
We shall wash these rebels away in a tide of their own blood! I will give them no quarter! You will give them only death!
These masterless wretches deserve some respect, but not too much. They are mad dogs, and should be treated with caution, lest they pass on their madness!
Ronin scum! Masterless and faithless to a man! And now they raise rebellion against their betters! It is time to put them in their graves!
I feel sorry for these rebels. Their only cause is ambition, a foul excess to any honest samurai. They will be happier dead at our hands.
These ronin think they have unleashed a storm-- and they have! But it is not their rebellion, only our righteous anger! Make ready!
Warriors, we face a cunning foe! These ronin have all the skill of honest warriors, but not one shred of honour! So: we are stronger!
Death is the only reward our foes can expect! They will die dishonoured and unclaimed by clan or family! That is the penalty for rebellion!
I feel for these ronin! They have been robbed of duty, honour and purpose! But I feel anger that chaos is their response! Make ready!
Warriors! Set aside all respect! The Ashikaga you face are base and traitorous! They serve one who plays at being shogun. Kill them all!
Warriors! Today we kill men who are loyal to a fool! They do not deserve such an end! But do not let sympathy weaken your blows!
We fight the Ashikaga! They stand for the indefensible and dishonourable! Right and strength are ours, weakness and death will be theirs! Forwards!
The warriors of this ghost shogun do not deserve our respect! Today, they deserve to die at your hands, sent to serve in Hell!
Do not think that we are the rebels here! They are traitors to everyone in this land, for they support a weakling! Now, make ready!
If the Ashikaga had honour, they would kill themselves. They have ruined our land, and must pay the price. What we do today is a start!
I would see these Ashikaga fools dead before the next sunset! Their weakness and cowardice are a stain on the character of the Japanese people!
Our Ashikaga foes serve a lord who is base, treacherous and unworthy of his position. If they had any sense, they would run or die of shame!
Are the Ashikaga witless? Can they not see that their time is over? Why must we fight? Ah! They are stubborn! We must show them their folly!
Those fools think that they serve a worthy lord! They do not! They must die! The Ashikaga have brought nothing but disgrace to the shogunate!
Even though our clan brothers are coming, fight as though we alone must win the day! When they arrive, they will be amazed by our courage!
There is another reason to be cheerful. Another army approaches, and may yet get here to help with our victory! That is good news!
And there is good news! Our daimyo is wise: another army marches to us! If they arrive, I will gladly share glory with them.
And although our clan brothers are coming to our aid, sometimes men make their own luck! We live or die here by our own efforts!
And, warriors, although aid is coming I will not rely on it. I say we can -- we will -- have victory before help comes!
Why should we rely on reinforcements? Our brothers are coming, but we have the strength we need to prevail! Take up your swords, then!
And think of this: another of our armies is marching even as I speak! Our clan brothers are coming to our aid with all speed!
Take heart, for you do not fight alone today! Your brother warriors are marching, even now, and will soon be here to support our efforts!
And be cheerful! Our clan is sending another army to the field! They are not far, and will arrive in time to help in our struggle!
I have word that there are more enemy armies coming to fight us. I trust they will be dogged with misfortune every step of the way.
We must fight with resolution. There are more enemies near and, unless the spirits misguide them, they may arrive in time to hinder us.
I have reports that another clan is marching to join our enemies. I pray that their steps are dogged by misfortune!
I have reports that enemy reinforcements are coming. I am sure, though, that the fools will get lost on the way, or drown themselves somehow.
My agents report that the enemy have reinforcements nearby. However, if we act quickly and with resolution, they will not arrive in time to influence events.
I have reports that our enemy expect their allies to save them. I also hear, and pray, that these allies will get here in time!
I am told that the enemy expect reinforcements to come. Good! There will be more of the fools to kill when that happens!
My agents tell me that our foes will have reinforcements. I say let them come! If we kill them now, we can rest on the morrow!
We must move swiftly, for my agents report that more enemies are near and are likely to reach the battle before its conclusion.
The mighty lord of our esteemed allies stands alongside us today! Be proud of this, and turn that pride into strength.
Our ally has done us a great honour to fight with us in person. His lordly presence should inspire us all to greater efforts.
If nothing else, fight with pride, because the eyes of an allied lord are on us today. Show him that we are worthy friends!
Our allies are relying on our strength. If we fail, then they are doomed. I do not relish that prospect: such shame would cloud our lives!
We are here to do more than fight a battle! We are here to save a noble clan. Our allies must triumph, or fall into darkness!
If we allow our allies here to be destroyed, what price our honour, or our word as friends? I say it shall not happen!
Our foes cannot afford to let this place fall! That means hard fighting, I will not deny it. But how much greater our glory when it is ours?
If we take this place, it is a severe blow to the enemy. His stratagems will falter, his ambitions will be thwarted, and his honour doubted!
When we take this place, it will be a bitter blow to our enemies. What price their wicked plans then? We will have maimed their prideful ambition!
Our foes must be troubled to be fighting in their own lands. They cannot keep their own people safe! What does that say about them?
I like this battlefield. This is enemy land. Let us hope, then, that we can wrest it from them by our efforts, and bury them beneath it!
Our enemies today are on the defensive. We fight on their lands, not on ours. The shame of an invasion weighs them down.
All battles matter, but this one has more significance than most. Our cause is at a crossroads: a victory sets our clan on the correct path!
The fight to come is important, for the fate of many will be determined by what we do here today. Victory is the desirable path!
We fight here for more than just a victory. This battle has a greater meaning: a purpose in the plans of our clan.
And think of this: we fight on our own lands today. This ground is hallowed by our clan blood, and blessed by the honoured dead!
This land is ours! Our clan has blessed this earth with our warriors' blood, shed in many battles. We have a duty to do as much here.
We fight to wipe away a stain on our honour. Enemies are here, on our lands! This is shameful indeed. They must be expelled!
I will speak honestly, for you deserve the truth. I need you to fight like demons! Nothing less will do, for victory here is of utmost importance!
This fight is about more than victory or our lives. It is a single step along our clan's path to greatness. There is no other way!
We do not fight merely for the pleasure of victory. We fight for our clan's rightful place in Japan. Remember that in what is to come.
I will speak plainly, for you deserve honesty: we have victory. Our cause teeters on an abyss. We have a chance to save it!
This is not a fight that we dare lose. The lives of our wives and children are at stake if we fail.
Everything you hold dear is at risk. Everything: family, honour, position, lands. That is why we must fight our hardest in the hours to come.
We will defend this place. We will not let it fall! If you are killed, keep on fighting: death is no excuse for slacking!
Every man here must do his duty to the utmost. We will not allow the enemy to take this place. If all else fails, throw yourselves at the foe!
The enemy cannot be allowed to take this place! Our banners must fly over the walls, even if it costs the life of every man here!
Our daimyo has been named an enemy of the state! I say it is the state that is false, to him! What man has done more for Japan? That is why we fight!
Our clan have been named as outlaws, enemies of Japan. What nonsense! How our foes must fear us to resort to such tricks!
Although we are called enemies of the state, traitors, monsters and worse, we know that we are honourable men of a noble clan.
Warriors! I will not lie to you. This is our final stand. There are two paths we can walk, both equally honourable: death or victory!
This fight is vital to our survival as an army and as a clan. I do not believe it is our destiny to be swept aside.
Here we must stand, and drive off the enemy. This is our last redoubt and the end of all hope if we do not hold the line.
Here we stand! We will defend our clan and our land to the utmost. My sword will be taken from my dead hand before I retreat!
I will not lie: we must stand here! There is nowhere to retreat, and I do not think I would have it otherwise.
I will not retreat from this spot. I will fight to the end. And you, being men worth leading, will surely do the same!
Men, your fight under the eye of your daimyo today. There is no prouder moment for any soldier. Do not disgrace yourselves!
This is a proud day for you all. You fight alongside your daimyo, and every act of bravery and duty will be seen!
You fight under the gaze of your daimyo. Faithful service will be rewarded, but no reward is greater than preserving him and our clan's further glory!
Our great lord has the prize within his reach! He can be Shogun, but only if we loyally support him. That may mean dying here!
Our clan can have the Shogunate! This battle is one step on the road to mastery of Japan. Fight hard, there is much at stake!
Our clan will have the Shogunate. This battle is but one step on that path. The enemy will fight, but we must have victory!
I see that our enemy have a daimyo on the field. Their allies, worthless dogs all, have brought their so-called lord with them! He should die!
Our enemies have a friend on the field. Their allies are lead by their daimyo. The man that brings me his banner earns my undying gratitude!
This is a day to prove your bravery, for the enemies' allies are commanded by their lord. He will witness your worth, and know despair!
Every defeat we can inflict is worthwhile, my warriors, but this one could be a very heavy blow. It will send our foes reeling.
Although defeating a foe is always a pleasure, we have a greater purpose here. Our foes cannot really afford to lose this fight.
If our foes are defeated here, their schemes will go awry. We can do them greater harm than the mere loss of an army.
If our foes are defeated here, their cause will suffer out of all proportion to their loss of lives. Reviving their fortunes would test a master Go strategist!
Our foes will be reluctant to quit this field without victory. They dare not fail, for it would be a terrible blow to their clan.
Our foes will fight like demons here, for their schemes of conquest and tyranny are at risk. They must fight, or face possible ruination.
I will tell you a secret: our foes dare not lose this battle. This will make them desperate men, and desperate men often act like fools! We have them!
This fight is one that our foes fear. If they lose, their cause is damaged, perhaps beyond all repair. I mean to do this.
A defeat here is a death blow to our enemies. Their spirits, hopes and dreams of conquest will all be shattered, if we do our duty.
The enemy have been named as enemies of the state. All of Japan will thank us for every one we kill, for every death weakens their treacherous master!
Our enemies today are the enemies of all Japan. Traitors to a man, they fight for a traitor in an ignoble and foul cause.
Every enemy we slay today is an enemy of Japan rightfully executed. We do the Shogun's work when we fight here!
Their general, I am told, is a brother to their daimyo. It would be a bitter grieving for the family if he were to die!
When this battle is done, I want their daimyo to weep, and weep again for the death of his own brother, the general yonder!
I will richly reward the man who kills their general. He is brother to their daimyo, and his loss would wound the man's heart.
Their general is a grandson of the clan leader. It would be a bitter blow to the old man if he were to die!
When this battle is done, I want their daimyo to weep for his losses, and for the death of his precious grandson, the enemy general!
The death of their general will be well rewarded. Their daimyo will weep to hear of his grandson's death at our hands!
Among our foes today is the heir of their daimyo. I will look with favour upon any man who can bring grief to his father.
It would be a fine thing to strike down their commander, the heir to his clan. Kill him, and kill their future!
The general over there is heir to all his clan's power. If he dies, their future looks a little bleaker! This is surely a good thing!
And remember: cut off the snake's head and its poison cannot harm you. Think, then: in the enemy ranks, you will find their daimyo.
Their daimyo is among the enemy ranks today. It would be a fine, even rewarding, thing for one of my men to cut him down.
The enemy army is commanded by their daimyo, I see. The man who takes his head will want for little when this battle is done!
One of the daimyo's sons is among our enemies today. Look for him! Cut him down! Give his father good cause for manly weeping!
The enemy general is the son of their daimyo. When we strike him down, his father will weep, and so will all his clan!
When we are done, let us make sure their general is in his grave. It will be a cruel blow to their daimyo, his father!
And consider this: our foes have nothing left, save their lives. Once we have taken those, they can no longer threaten our homes and families.
And remember: our foes face a bitter end here. They will fight hard, for there is nothing else for them to do. Give them honourable deaths.
Our foes must make a stand, or history will not remember them. Perhaps, one day, a poet will compose a sad line about their fate!
The enemy have nowhere to run. They must fight here, or be destroyed utterly. This will make them desperate, and dangerous! So what?
Our foes cannot retreat from here. We can exterminate them if we have but the will to strike hard and the courage not to flinch.
Our foes are like rats, trapped in a rice sack! They have no escape! Let us drown them, in their own blood if need be!
This battle is vital to our foes. Their daimyo thinks he is worthy to be Shogun. If we defeat his army, his ambitions are thwarted.
The enemy lord has pretensions of ruling Japan! I say: no! I do not like to think of our people crushed at his evil whim!
Those vile, inhuman beasts serve a man who would be the master of Japan. He would make us all his slaves! What arrogance! What foolishness!
